Pre-Game Insights: The Faroe Islands will face North Macedonia at the Tórsvøllur on Saturday in the opening game of their 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaign.

The home side enjoyed a positive Nations League campaign in 2022, shaking off their slow start to the tournament before embarking on a strong finish to their group-stage run which included a shock 2-1 victory over group winners Turkey.
North Macedonia have also endured a difficult run of results in recent games and will hope they can find better luck elsewhere this weekend.
The visitors will be targeting a winning start to their Nations League campaign this weekend before returning to home soil, where they will face Armenia next week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Saturday's game will mark just the second meeting between the Faroe Islands and North Macedonia.
The two sides faced off for the first-ever time in a friendly clash last March which the visitors won 1-0 via a late strike from Girona striker Bojan Miovski.
The hosts have managed just two clean sheets in their last 22 games across all competitions.
The Lions were ranked 72nd in the latest FIFA rankings and now sit 66 places above their weekend opponents.
